programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Sister Rebecca Snipe returns to North Fork after an extended visit. Lucas' son Mark is smitten and plans to play matchmaker for his dad. However, the Snipe brothers get involved to make sure Lucas is good enough for Rebecca.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E10 New Orleans Menace Wealthy Frenchman Cesar Tiffauges, who is used to getting whatever he desires, wants to buy the McCain Ranch. Tiffauges, a sadistic man, abuses his followers regularly with beatings. When Lucas refuses, his son Mark becomes the object of cruelty.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E1 Saddle Up, Partner After going their separate ways to focus on individual pursuits, the cowboys come back together to help a friend rope some wild hogs. Realizing they still make a good team, they decide to partner up again to take their operation to a new level. Grandma reminds Booger of his family's deep roots in the Florida cattle business, and Booger is inspired to look south for work in areas that aren't affected by the drought. Bubba and Kaley host the gang for a cowboy-inspired gender reveal party. Cody surprises Misty with the plans to move forward on building their dream home.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S7 E2 Trigger Happy The cowboys show off their skills during a round up in South Florida and score a promising new venture with a big-time rancher. Soon, they are in over their heads as they attempt to gather enough cattle to fill his 7000-acre pasture. Back home, Bubba has an even bigger challenge as he tries to rustle up the right food to satisfy Kaley's pregnancy cravings. Misty's health scare causes Cody to put their home-building plans on hold once again. Booger convinces Matthew that it's time to give up his treasured pony, Trigger, in order to move up to a bigger horse.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E4 Obituary Newspaperman Byron Claremont writes an article about old gunslinger, Ben Russell, who settled down years ago. The article brings in a young gun, who murders Russell. Next, Claremont writes about Lucas McCain and his rifle, which brings more tragedy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E5 Tension Lucas and Mark help Sid Halpern with his cattle drive. When bounty hunter Clemmie Martin confronts Halpern and gunfire erupts, Halpern and Martin both perish. Lucas tries to hide Halpern's criminal past from his widow and son.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E28 The Majority of Wilton Captain Wilton Parmenter qualifies for a promotion to the rank of major in the army. However, he must pass a demanding examination first. O'Rourke and Agarn offer help but Parmenter's efforts to study are jeopardized by a bad cold and home remedies.

programme.title: F Troop
programme.desc: S2 E29 Our Brave in Chief Wild Eagle hides in Fort Courage to see the army dentist. A visiting general comes for inspection and mistakes him for a soldier. He promotes Chief Wild Eagle but later realizes these actions could ruin his career if anyone discovers the truth.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E8 The Many Faces of Charles Siringo Unable to apprehend the train-robbing Smith Brothers, Sheriff Doc Shores calls the Pinkerton Detective Agency for assistance. The agency sends Charles Siringo, an undercover specialist known for his unorthodox methods of capturing criminals.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E3 Bass Reeves Tracks Belle Starr As U.S. Marshal Bass Reeves attempts to arrest Belle Starr and her outlaw husband, Belle asks for 24 hours to find someone to care for her young daughter, Pearl. When the Starr family decides to flee instead, the Marshal must track them down.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E7 Jim Clyman: Frontier Survivor When he is separated from his trapping party, frontiersman Jim Clyman is 600 miles from the nearest fort. To survive the grueling trek, he must put his fate in the hands of Native Americans, without knowing if they will help him or kill him on sight.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E7 Initiation Jimmy captures Jesse's brother Frank James after a bank robbery. Jesse feels that he needs to be loyal to his brother and breaks him out of jail. This forces Teaspoon and Jimmy to go out on the hunt to bring him back in for justice.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S4 E1 The Rebellion Cheyenne travels to Mexico to deliver freight. He soon becomes entangled in a murder plot, and the brutal leader of the French troops forces Cheyenne to stand against him. Mexican rebels, including an old foe, rescue him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S4 E2 Trial by Conscience Newly deputized, Cheyenne brings law and order to a small town after the murder of its sheriff. Once there, he uses an old stage trick from the play "Hamlet" to bring a corrupt businessman to justice for murder.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Avenger Hoss and Joe desperately look for a way to prevent brothers Adam and Ben from being hanged for a crime. A stranger, Lassiter, comes to town in an attempt to find the truth and prove Adam and Ben's innocence.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E11 The Apprentice Sheriff Dan Willard fills in as deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. Meanwhile, Texas cowhands come to town looking for fun and relaxation. When Dan tries to prove that his toughness, those actions backfire.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Angry Gun Lucas and Mark, returning after selling their herd, share the stagecoach trip with a marshal and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton. Johnny's gang stops and robs the stagecoach, while Johnny steals Lucas' gun and profits. Lucas is forced to track him down.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Gatling Gun
programme.desc: An Apache warrior chief is willing to offer gold, and even sacrifice some of his men, to get his hands on Richard J. Gatling's powerful invention. It's up to a cavalry lieutenant, his scout, and a tough rancher to end the chief's deadly ambition.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E6 Eddie's Daughter Eddie Halstead is a hotel clerk in North Fork. His daughter, Lillian, who he hasn't seen since childhood, arrives in town. She is now a dance hall girl and Lucas discovers criminals are following her, focused on the stolen money in her possession.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E7 Panic Lucas and Mark find a young couple in a wagon who are suffering from a fever. Lucas takes them to his ranch where a doctor confirms it to be yellow fever. No-good Brett Conway spreads the word in North Fork and panic sets in.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E2 Billy the Kid: Birth of an Outlaw Teenaged fugitive William Bonney is given a second chance when a kindhearted ranch owner offers him a job. But when his new employer is killed in cold blood, Bonney reverts to his criminal ways, seeking vengeance and transforming into Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E10 The Discoveries of George McJunkin After a devastating storm, ranch foreman George McJunkin finds ancient bison fossils and flint points unearthed in a riverbank, and he sets out to find someone in the scientific community who will acknowledge the importance of his discovery.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S2 E3 Andrew Henry: Man of His Word Though Andrew Henry has little experience when he partners in a trapping expedition, he pledges his word to complete the risky venture. As Blackfeet warriors close in, he must weigh his personal integrity against the lives of the men he leads.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E8 Just Like Old Times On the anniversary of his brother's death, The Kid leaves the station to spend some time alone. Lou tracks him down to check on him. Later, the Kid's childhood girlfriend arrives in town, bringing back even more memories for him to deal with.

programme.title: Racers Unchained
programme.desc: From the moment Bill Auberlen's dad gave him his race car, his life has been built on speed. He talks with Paul Tracy about being the most successful IMSA driver in history, taking chances that changed his career, and his fast-paced life off-track.

programme.title: 2026 King of the Hammers
programme.desc: Only the strongest competitors and machines compete in this one-of-a-kind off-road race that requires both speed and survival to finish this true test of man and machine.

programme.desc: An iconic Hurst Oldsmobile emerges from years in storage and roars back to life in the shop. Meanwhile, a cold call takes Tony to a Chevelle project that creates more questions...h it.

programme.desc: Caring for classic automobiles.

programme.title: Lost Classics
programme.desc: Tony helps prep a quirky, rare British TVR for sale and makes a play for one of the most elusive Camaros ever built, the legendary ZL1. When Tony is offered a rust-free '55 Chevy he knows it's a too good of a deal to pass up.

programme.title: My Classic Car
programme.desc: Host Dennis Gage upholds his "honor the timeless classics" catchphrase in this series, as he travels across North America to visit prestigious auto shows and events, spotlighting everything from muscle cars to museum pieces. The handlebar mustachioed Gage takes viewers along for the ride and keeps it entertaining with his unique perspective and enthusiasm for all things automotive.

programme.desc: Stacey rolls in one of the show cars of the 1970s, the Mod Rod; after that, he shows how to properly disassemble the cab or body of your project and pre-fit some new components at the same time.

programme.desc: Sam tackles the suspension in the '79 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am.

programme.title: Jesse James at Bay
programme.desc: When a railroad company cheats Missouri farmers out of their land, Sheriff Whittaker (George "Gabby" Hayes) alerts his friend, kindhearted outlaw Jesse James (Roy Rogers), about their problem. As Jesse comes out of retirement to help the farmers, his evil look-alike, Clint Burns (also Rogers), appears in town to create havoc. Reporters Polly (Sally Payne) and Jane (Gale Storm) pressure the sheriff and railroad manager Phineas Krager (Pierre Watkin) about the increasingly tense situation.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: Biz Kids
programme.desc: Teaching financial education and entrepreneurship to a preteen audience; using sketch comedy and young actors to explain basic economic concepts.

programme.title: Sports Stars of Tomorrow
programme.desc: Profiles of the top rookie, college and high-school talent in sports; current athletes share their experiences, advice and personal impressions of the road to stardom.

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: Blackout
programme.desc: As global tensions between the U.S. and China erupt, a nuclear strike plunges the world into chaos. Former Army operatives Noah and Ella Daniels, along with their friends Cai and Knox, seek refuge in their business warehouse -- but safety is short.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Ben Cartwright is the patriarch of an all-male Nevada ranching family. Set during and after the Civil War, "Bonanza" is the story of life on the family's thousand-acre spread, known as the Ponderosa, near Virginia City. Ben has his three sons, each with a different (and deceased) mother. Serious eldest son Adam hopes to follow in his father's footsteps; middle son Hoss is a gentle giant -- physically strong, but sometimes naive; and youngest son Little Joe is the most impetuous and romantic of the offspring.

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: (1948) Historical adventure. A man (Louis Hayward) returns from the Wars of the Roses to learn from his uncle that a family friend has killed his father. But is everything as it seems?

programme.title: To Hell and Back
programme.desc: (1955) Fact-based wartime drama. Audie Murphy, America's most decorated soldier in WWII, plays himself in this dramatic recreation of the valiant heroics that earned him the honours.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Canyon Passage
programme.desc: (1946) Frontier western starring Dana Andrews. An ambitious businessman journeys to rural Oregon where a complex web of life and love waits to ensnare him. Directed by Jacques Tourneur.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning turn-of-the-century drama with Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins. A Montana patriarch's son falls for his brother's fiancée, setting off a tragic chain of events.

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly-tinged but ultimately feel-good comedy starring Tom Hanks as a grumpy misanthrope who spends his time badgering people into following society's rules. But why is he like this?

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller about a British couple who get drawn into a Russian mafia conspiracy. With Ewan McGregor, Naomie Harris, Stellan Skarsgård and Damian Lewis. Based on John le Carré's novel.

programme.title: Night of the 12th
programme.desc: (2022) Award-winning, gritty true-crime drama following a faltering police investigation into the grisly murder of a young woman. With Bastien Bouillon and Bouli Lanners. In French/subs.

programme.title: The Shepherd of the Hills
programme.desc: (1941) John Wayne stars as a moody young man living in the Ozarks who has sworn revenge on his long-absent father for deserting his mother. Then a kindly stranger appears on the scene...

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: (1959) Satirical comedy starring Peter Sellers (in a triple role) and the original Doctor Who, William Hartnell. The world's smallest state, Grand Fenwick, declares war on the USA.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: (1954) Tough western. A cavalry doctor (Robert Francis) discovers a Native American tribe is dying of malaria, but his by-the-book captain (Phil Carey) refuses to allow their treatment.

programme.title: Shenandoah
programme.desc: (1965) Western. James Stewart stars as a wealthy Virginia farming patriarch trying to keep his family together and safe in the midst of the encroaching American Civil War.

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: (2013) Sci-fi action-mystery set on a war-ravaged planet Earth that's been largely abandoned by humanity. With Tom Cruise, Andrea Riseborough, Olga Kurylenko and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Beau Is Afraid
programme.desc: (2023) Joaquin Phoenix stars in Ari Aster's fantastical odyssey about an anxiety-riddled man-boy working his way through a variety of psychological horrors to visit his domineering mother.

programme.title: Public Enemies
programme.desc: (2009) Michael Mann directs Johnny Depp as infamous bank robber John Dillinger; Marion Cotillard as Dillinger's sorta girl; and Christian Bale as the FBI agent trying to put him away.

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: (1983) Comedy starring Peter Riegert, Burt Lancaster and Peter Capaldi. A US oil company executive tries to persuade a small Scottish seaside community to sell up their entire village.

programme.title: Hail the Conquering Hero
programme.desc: (1944) Satirical wartime comedy starring Eddie Bracken as a man who becomes a celebrated war hero despite having been medically discharged from the marines after only a few weeks.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: (1953) Western. Rock Hudson stars as a California-bound settler who must ride 1500 miles to the Mexican border to rescue his fiancée (Donna Reed) after she's abducted by an outlaw.

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: (1963) Classic interpretation of the Greek myth of Jason's quest to find the Golden Fleece, boasting the enduring work of special effects maestro Ray Harryhausen. Directed by Don Chaffey.

programme.title: Moon
programme.desc: (2009) Psychological sci-fi thriller. Sam Rockwell stars as a man who lives alone on the moon overseeing a mining operation. His time's nearly done, but he's started to go a bit peculiar...

programme.title: The Pope's Exorcist
programme.desc: (2023) Supernatural horror starring Russell Crowe, loosely based on the memoirs of a 'real' exorcist. A case of demonic possession in Spain connects to dark secrets from the Inquisition.

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: (2003) Action with Colin Farrell and Samuel L Jackson. A loose canon joins an elite force to escort a fugitive to chokey. But the baddie's put a reward out for help with his escape.

programme.title: xXx: The Next Level
programme.desc: (2005) Action thriller sequel with Samuel L Jackson, Ice Cube and Willem Dafoe. There's a new Triple X agent in town and he's up against some shady government business.

programme.title: Destroyer
programme.desc: (1943) Second World War drama about a warship assigned to mail runs but that ends up engaged in battle anyway, starring Edward G Robinson, Glenn Ford and Marguerite Chapman.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: (1961) Drama. Spencer Tracy stars as an unfairly unpopular priest living on a volcanic South Sea island which is about to erupt. With Kerwin Matthews, Frank Sinatra and Barbara Luna.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
programme.desc: (2018) Rami Malek turns in an Oscar-winning performance as Freddie Mercury in this rollercoaster musical biopic of the late Queen frontman. Big tunes. Big drama. Bigger teeth.

programme.title: Benedetta
programme.desc: (2021) Paul Verhoeven's historical drama. Sex and the sacred collide as a Renaissance nun begins to have visions of Christ, while also taking a shine to one of her sisters. In French/subs.

programme.title: In Fear
programme.desc: (2013) Psychological horror with Iain De Caestecker and Alice Englert. A couple get lost in remote rural lanes as they drive to a music festival. Frustration turns to fear as dusk falls...

programme.title: Lifeboat
programme.desc: (1944) Alfred Hitchcock's Oscar-nominated Second World War drama starring Tallulah Bankhead, William Bendix and Walter Slezak as three of the survivors from a liner torpedoed by the Nazis.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Stormbreaker
programme.desc: (2006) Family action-thriller with Alex Pettyfer and Mickey Rourke. British intelligence recruit a schoolboy to take on the man who killed his dad and is planning to unleash a deadly virus.

programme.title: The Personal History of David...
programme.desc: ...Copperfield: (2019) Armando Iannucci's critically acclaimed comedy-drama reinvention of the classic Charles Dickens novel, starring Dev Patel, Tilda Swinton and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: (2019) Heart-warming comedy based on the real-life story of the Cornish folk ensemble who took the UK charts by storm in 2010, starring Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton.

programme.title: The Other Woman
programme.desc: (2014) Romcom starring Cameron Diaz, Leslie Mann, Kate Upton and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau. Three women take revenge on the man who betrayed their love. Strong language, scenes that may offend.

programme.title: The Fury
programme.desc: (1978) Brian De Palma's supernatural horror with Kirk Douglas, John Cassavetes, Andrew Stevens and Amy Irving. A shadowy agency abducts a young man with telekinetic powers.

programme.title: The Lighthouse
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-nominated psychological horror starring Willem Dafoe and Robert Pattinson. A pair of lighthouse keepers dangerously descend into insanity on a remote island.
